title: Today's NYT Strands Hints, Answers and Help for May 5, #428
description: Here are hints and answers for the NYT Strands puzzle No. 428 for May 5.
author: Gael Cooper
excerpt: Here are hints and answers for the NYT Strands puzzle No. 428 for May 5.
text: Looking for the most recent Strands answer? Click here for our daily Strands hints, as well as our daily answers and hints for The New York Times Mini Crossword, Wordle, Connections and Connections: Sports Edition puzzles.Todays NYT Strands puzzle involves my teenage daughter's favorite food, which can be made in many varieties. If you need hints and answers, read on.I go into depth about the rules for Strands in this story. If you're looking for today's Wordle, Connections and Mini Crossword answers, you can visit CNET's NYT puzzle hints page.Read more: NYT Connections Turns 1: These Are the 5 Toughest Puzzles So FarHint for today's Strands puzzleToday's Strands theme is: On the side.If that doesn't help you, here's a clue: McDonald's has great ones.Clue words to unlock in-game hintsYour goal is to find hidden words that fit the puzzle's theme. If you're stuck, find any words you can. Every time you find three words of four letters or more, Strands will reveal one of the theme words. These are the words I used to get those hints, but any words of four or more letters that you find will work:SATE, SEAT, SEEK, SEEKS, MEEK, LINE, KEYS, FACE, RINK, STIR, HOSS, RING.Answers for today's Strands puzzleThese are the answers that tie into the theme. The goal of the puzzle is to find them all, including the spangram, a theme word that reaches from one side of the puzzle to the other. When you have all of them (I originally thought there were always eight but learned that the number can vary), every letter on the board will be used. Here are the nonspangram answers:HOME, CURLY, CRINKLE, STEAK, WAFFLE, SHOESTRING.Today's Strands spangram The completed NYT Strands puzzle for May 5, 2025, #428. NYT/Screenshot by CNETToday's Strands spangram is FRENCHFRIES. To find it, start with the F that's four down on the farthest right row and wind backwards and up.
html:
Looking for the most recent Strands answer? Click here for our daily Strands hints, as well as our daily answers and hints for The New York Times Mini Crossword, Wordle, Connections and Connections: Sports Edition puzzles.

Todays NYT Strands puzzle involves my teenage daughter's favorite food, which can be made in many varieties. If you need hints and answers, read on.

I go into depth about the rules for Strands in this story. 

If you're looking for today's Wordle, Connections and Mini Crossword answers, you can visit CNET's NYT puzzle hints page.

Read more: NYT Connections Turns 1: These Are the 5 Toughest Puzzles So Far

Hint for today's Strands puzzle

Today's Strands theme is: On the side.

If that doesn't help you, here's a clue: McDonald's has great ones.

Clue words to unlock in-game hints

Your goal is to find hidden words that fit the puzzle's theme. If you're stuck, find any words you can. Every time you find three words of four letters or more, Strands will reveal one of the theme words. These are the words I used to get those hints, but any words of four or more letters that you find will work:

  • SATE, SEAT, SEEK, SEEKS, MEEK, LINE, KEYS, FACE, RINK, STIR, HOSS, RING.

Answers for today's Strands puzzle

These are the answers that tie into the theme. The goal of the puzzle is to find them all, including the spangram, a theme word that reaches from one side of the puzzle to the other. When you have all of them (I originally thought there were always eight but learned that the number can vary), every letter on the board will be used. Here are the nonspangram answers:

  • HOME, CURLY, CRINKLE, STEAK, WAFFLE, SHOESTRING.

Today's Strands spangram

Today's Strands spangram is FRENCHFRIES. To find it, start with the F that's four down on the farthest right row and wind backwards and up.
